section.p: The SDK sets the audio data format in the following callbacks based on :
The SDK sets the audio data format in the following callbacks based on :

You can pass an object in the following APIs to set the audio data format for the corresponding callback:
: Sets the data format for the callback.
: Sets the data format for the callback.
: Sets the data format for the callback.
: Sets the data format for the callback.

ul.li: The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in , and triggers the , , , and callbacks based on that interval.
Ensure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 (s).
The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in , and triggers the , , , and callbacks accordingly.
Ensure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 (s).
The SDK calculates the sampling interval based on the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in , and triggers the , , , and callbacks accordingly.
Make sure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 (s).
The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in , and triggers the , , , and callbacks based on this interval.
Make sure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 (s).

plentry.pd:
Sampling rate of the data in Hz. Supported values:
8000
16000 (default)
32000
44100
48000

Number of audio channels. Supported values:
1: Mono (default)
2: Stereo
Usage mode of the data. See .
Number of samples per call, typically 1024 in scenarios like media push.
